channel.title: A Few Questions
channel.description: Now that I've got my client to connect, I want to do something more interesting than changing colours and text. I don't have much experience, so I want to try something simple. I tried the HP over heads, but I couldn't find [b]anything[/b] that I needed to find when I searched, if anyone could help me with that...Or I was thinking it would be interesting and useful to know how to send messages on the chat window. It says 'Welcome To RuneScape' when you log in, that is sent from the server though, is there any way to send something like that from within the client? How can I do this? [code] Runescape Build #455 getCanvas() added to class "client" gets static field "kd.java.awt.Canvas lb" getBytes() added to class "oa" gets field "oa.byte[] g" getPassword() added to class "client" gets static field "ld.oa I" getUsername() added to class "client" gets static field "ld.oa b" getPlayerValids() added to class "client" gets static field "jc.int[] X" getPlayers() added to class "client" gets static field "ed.hf[] Sb" getPlayerCount() added to class "client" gets static field "me.int Mb" getName() added to class "hf" gets field "hf.oa Qc" getMessage() added to class "wb" gets field "wb.oa vb" getMonsterValids() added to class "client" gets static field "n.int[] v" getMonsters() added to class "client" gets static field "fb.wd[] f" getMonsterCount() added to class "client" gets static field "me.int Mb" getComposite() added to class "wd" gets field "wd.uc Rc" getName() added to class "uc" gets field "uc.oa gb" getID() added to class "uc" gets field "uc.int xb" getLevel() added to class "hf" gets field "hf.int Ic" getLevel() added to class "uc" gets field "uc.int yb" getPlayerMe() added to class "client" gets static field "kd.hf Pb" getChatMessages() added to class "client" gets static field "jc.oa[] ab" getChatTypes() added to class "client" gets static field "wb.int[] Hc" getChatNames() added to class "client" gets static field "va.oa[] s" getChatStatePublic() added to class "client" gets static field "ld.int g" getChatStatePrivate() added to class "client" gets static field "he.int g" getChatStateRequest() added to class "client" gets static field "je.int m" getWorldX() added to class "client" gets static field "cf.int v" getXloc() added to class "wb" gets field "wb.int[] sb" getWorldY() added to class "client" gets static field "kb.int J" getYloc() added to class "wb" gets field "wb.int[] lc" getHp() added to class "wb" gets field "wb.int Xb" getHpMax() added to class "wb" gets field "wb.int Ab" getHeight() added to class "wb" gets field "wb.int added to class "client" gets static field "sd.int[] gb" getSkillLevels() added to class "client" gets static field "qb.int[] vb" getSkillExperiences() added to class "client" gets static field static field "ve.boolean J" getMenuType() added to class "client" gets static field "h.int bb" getMenuY() added to class "client" gets static field "dd.int b" getMenuX() added to class "client" gets static field "uc.int Sb" Updated in 3094ms. [/code] It doesn't say the old names like method1234() or does it? How can I change, for example method1234() to getX() or something? These are all noobie questions, but I try to be a noobie, not a n00b, as there is a difference. I really appreciate the people who help me out, thanks! Unhandled

item.title: A Few Questions
item.dc:creator: @sup000 sup000
item.description:
@sup000 wrote:

by chance? I think i remember a previous update where they stated that they had made this possible for more than one player to take the resource to make it fairer. Was this a sly cover up for the chance of duplicate ‘bones’?

Read full topic

item.title: A Few Questions
item.dc:creator: @semaphore semaphore
item.description:
@semaphore wrote:

[quote=“Unhandled, post:19, topic:80186”]Just wondering, for say woodcutting or mining, its the client that decides how fast you cut/mine right?
Like randomInt + SkillLevel = HitsNeeded or something? I know skill levels are fetched server side, but doesn’t the client do the calculations? So you could print how many more hits you need I’m probably completely off here, but it doesn’t seem completely unlikely.[/quote]

Nope. The server decides it all for you. All your client does is sends the server the packets telling it you wish to ‘chop/mine’. It is the server that decides when/if to throw you a bone. However, there are times when (completely by chance) the server decides to send you and possibly someone else a bone at the same time. Since the outbound messages are flushed once per game loop cycle, they seemingly don’t bother to ‘coalesce’ the packets by looking for 'duplicate bone’s. In other words, it is sometimes possible for you and joe schmo to get the coal at the same time. This is because the server (by chance) decided that you and he were to get a goodie in the exact same game loop cycle. There is no known way to force this.

Read full topic

@Unhandled wrote:

Just wondering, for say woodcutting or mining, its the client that decides how fast you cut/mine right?
Like randomInt + SkillLevel = HitsNeeded or something? I know skill levels are fetched server side, but doesn’t the client do the calculations? So you could print how many more hits you need I’m probably completely off here, but it doesn’t seem completely unlikely.

item.title: A Few Questions
item.dc:creator: @yakman yakman
item.description:
@yakman wrote:

hp announcer yeah!!
well for that, id need to know how to get the name of the person, i dont know that yet.

heres how i would do it…
look at the older version of the hp accouncer, it got the players name with reflection
use jad or jode on it, find out which field it was getting
find it in the deob

as for typing it, thats easy
look for the string ‘addKeyListener’, find the component which it gets added to,
get the keylistener from it and make some fake events, look in the older hp announcer for an example

anyone of your guys who knows the client better want to tell me a shortcut for finding the guys name?
also any other information you can get from it (inventory items, combat level, skills)

Read full topic

Just looking over the code, it seems this morning when I was just doing quick searches with Grep that I was correct with the Class66_sub1_sub1_sub1 stuff, I don’t remember using anything from class 32 or 21 so that is probably where I went wrong, since I was in a rush I probably misread and used the wrong methods rolls eyes.

item.title: A Few Questions
item.dc:creator: @yakman yakman
item.description:
@yakman wrote:

heres the important code, in Class27

		    if (Class66_Sub1_Sub13.anInt2856 > -1) {
			int i_29_ = (30*class66_sub1_sub9_sub7.anInt3633/class66_sub1_sub9_sub7.anInt3610);
			if ((i_29_ ^ 0xffffffff) < -31)
			    i_29_ = 30;

			int currentHp= class66_sub1_sub9_sub7.anInt3633;
			int maxHp= class66_sub1_sub9_sub7.anInt3610;

			double hpRatio = (double)currentHp / (double)maxHp;

			String aboveHead = "@gre@"+currentHp+"/"+maxHp;
			if( hpRatio < (2d/3d) ) aboveHead = currentHp+"/"+maxHp;
			if( hpRatio < (1d/3d) ) aboveHead = "@red@"+currentHp+"/"+maxHp;
			if( hpRatio == 0d ) {
				String[] color = new String[]{"@gre@","","@red@"};
				aboveHead = color[(int)(Math.random() * 3)] + currentHp+"/"+maxHp;
			}
			
			hpAboveHeadHolder= Class21.method198(255,aboveHead);
			Class66_Sub1_Sub1_Sub1 hpAboveHeadDisplayer = Class32.method254(Class80.aClass53_1752,i^~0x5863,Canvas_Sub1.aClass70_Sub1_61,Class26.aClass53_572);
			hpAboveHeadDisplayer.method540(hpAboveHeadHolder,Class66_Sub1_Sub13.anInt2856,Class31.anInt692,16776960,true);

			//this part draws the normal health bar
			//Class66_Sub1_Sub1.method525(-15+(Class66_Sub1_Sub13.anInt2856),-3+Class31.anInt692,i_29_,5,65280);
			//Class66_Sub1_Sub1.method525(-15+((Class66_Sub1_Sub13.anInt2856)- -i_29_),-3+Class31.anInt692,-i_29_+30,5,16711680);
		    }

by the way, iv made it so the text changes color, green if its 0.66> yellow if its 0.33> and red if its >0.33, if the hp is 0, it choses a random color so it looks like its flashing

heres the source http://www.megaupload.com/?d=IJZCS4NY

Read full topic

item.title: A Few Questions
item.dc:creator: @yakman yakman
item.description:
@yakman wrote:

regecks`:

HP over heads requires you to find a certain block of code that is responsible for drawing the HP bars (search for / 30, or - 30, or something). However, I believe it is no longer viable to do, due to method counters.

it is possible, iv done it with the current deob

in the current deob, its in Class27, looks a bit like this

if( int2 ^ £$&& > -31)
 int2 = 30;

look for the string “> -31)” or “= 30;”

just above that you’ll find something like this

anInt45 = (30 * anotherInt / thirtInt);

im not at home right now, but when i get back i can upload my copy if you want

item.title: A Few Questions
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

His updater pulls the client from your cache file for some reason, that error seems to be a problem with that, maybe you don’t have permission to write there, or that you simply don’t have a cache there.

With a little work, you can change it to download the jar from http://sl2.runescape.com/runescape.jar and use that.

Read full topic

item.title: A Few Questions
item.dc:creator: @marluxia marluxia
item.description:
@marluxia wrote:

go into ClientPackage.java and replace

File f = new File("C:\\WINDOWS\\.jagex_cache_32\\runescape\\main_file_cache.dat0");

with

File f = new File("C:\\WINDOWS\\.file_store_32\\runescape\\main_file_cache.dat0");

careful theres two of them

Read full topic

item.title: A Few Questions
item.dc:creator: @marluxia marluxia
item.description:
@marluxia wrote:

you’ll need bcel.jar & to compile it use

@echo off
title Compiling...
javac -cp .;bcel.jar; com\bawt\update\*.java com\bawt\hook\*.java
pause

and to run is

@echo off
java -cp .\bcel.jar; com.bawt.update.ClientPatcher
pause

Read full topic

item.title: A Few Questions
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

Allright, I’ll try PSB’s updater, however I’ve downloaded it, and there is 3 folders, each containing some .java files. Which do I run? Or do I have to run each one seperately? Are there any parameters I need to specify?

Read full topic

item.title: A Few Questions
item.dc:creator: @regecks1 regecks`
item.description:
@regecks1 wrote:

Well, the methods are made using an API called BCEL. It basically let’s you manipulate classfiles, add/delete/edit things in the actual classfile.

Programs like pplsuqbawlz’ updater use BCEL to add new methods to the original client classes, such as getX(). I recommend you have a look at his updater source code, or perhaps have a small play around with BCEL/class files, if you are up to that level.

The updater itself searches for patterns/things that remain the same across client versions, to find the raw fields for the ‘x’ value, and then just generates a method called getX to return that ‘x’ field.

Read full topic

item.title: A Few Questions
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

Ohhh, that cleared a few things up, I guess my question now is how do I generate those methods?
Thanks.

Read full topic

item.title: A Few Questions
item.dc:creator: @regecks1 regecks`
item.description:
@regecks1 wrote:

Methods like getX() do not actually exist in the client. We are not renaming them, we are generating them, so we can use them for our own purposes.

HP over heads requires you to find a certain block of code that is responsible for drawing the HP bars (search for / 30, or - 30, or something). However, I believe it is no longer viable to do, due to method counters. Maybe you can use raw graphics drawing to do it.

Read full topic
